questions.question_text:
A technician is preparing to set up a gaming computer with the following components:
✑ Discrete, high-end graphics card
✑ Video capture card
✑ High-end processor
✑ Multiple hard drives
✑ USB 3.0 hub
✑ Sound card
Which of the following options is the MOST important for the technician to consider before building the gaming computer?

discussion.content:
Answer should be D.
If your power supply cannot handle the wattage required, having a redundant supply won't matter.
This man wants to put every card known to mankind in his pc, so its D because you have to make sure you have the juice to run all those cards.

Selected Answer: D
D. Power supply wattage rating.

With high-performance components such as a discrete high-end graphics card, video capture card, high-end processor, multiple hard drives, and a USB hub, the overall power consumption will be significant.
A is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
Yea pretty sure redundant power supply isn't a major concern if the PC is just used for gaming

Selected Answer: D
D. Power supply wattage rating is the MOST important for the technician to consider before building the gaming computer. This is because a high-end graphics card, video capture card, high-end processor, multiple hard drives, and USB 3.0 hub will require a large amount of power to function properly. The wattage rating of the power supply must match the requirements of these components to avoid power problems and instability in the computer. If the power supply is not powerful enough, it can cause component failure, system crashes, and other problems. Thus, it is crucial for the technician to choose a power supply with an adequate wattage rating that can support all the components of the gaming computer.

The tricky thing in this question is multiple hard drives; you need a redundant supply. and redundant power supply will be more powerful anyway, which means you will have enough power for your system.

Just guessing =)

comments.content:
You do not need redundant power supplies to power multiple hard drives. Also, two 200W power supplies being used for redundancy still provides less power than one 600W power supply, so your second statement is incorrect.
The most important factor here is that you have enough power to support his high-end components.
Correct me if I'm wrong, but you need redundant PS for RAID, yes?

discussion.content: D is correct answer

Selected Answer: D
D. Power supply wattage rating

Selected Answer: D
The answer is D.

Selected Answer: D
Need to know the wattage to see if the power supply is strong enough to run all the equipment. It is not a machine that NEEDS built in redundancy.

Selected Answer: D
Power supply wattage rating

choices.D: Rogue virtual machines installed on the hypervisor

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the PRIMARY security concern with virtual machine escape?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Virtual machine escape is an exploit in which the attacker runs code on a VM that allows an operating system running within it to break out and interact directly with the hypervisor
bbbbbbbbbbbbbbb

Selected Answer: B
Compromising the hypervisor

questions.question_text: An IT manager is requesting that the company buy new cables to be used with F-type connectors that are already in house. Which of the following cables should the company buy?

discussion.content:
Coaxial with f- connector 

A answer

Selected Answer: A
The F-type connector is commonly used with coaxial cables, which are cables that consist of an inner conductor surrounded by a layer of insulation, a layer of shielding, and an outer cover. Coaxial cables are used in various applications, including cable TV, satellite TV, and networking, and they are known for their ability to transmit signals over long distances without loss of quality. Therefore, if the company already has F-type connectors in-house, the most appropriate cable to use with them would be coaxial.

Selected Answer: A
I think coaxial. F-type connectors are commonly used to conduct an electrical signal to TV sets, cable modems. Can be paired with: RG6 cables. RG59 cables, which are coaxial based. The question stating "In house" would make sense in this scenario

comments.content: Right, F-type connectors are coaxial based so that removes cat 5e, and F-type connectors are not used for fiber so that is out as well. We aren't talking about plenum spaces for plenum cables so thats out and we're left with A.

questions.question_text: A customer reports that a computer is never able to reach more than a 100Mbps transfer data rate, even when using a Gigabit LAN card. While troubleshooting, the technician notices the network cable needs to be replaced. Which of the following cable categories is limiting the transfer speed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Cat 5 stands for 100mbps maximum, so is a faster ethernet cable not a gigabit!
the standards are:
Cat 5 100mbps distance 100 meters
Cat 5e 1000mbps (1GB)distance 100 meters
***Cat 6 1000mbps(1GB) with 100 meters and also 10GB with 55 meters
Cat 6A 10000mbps(10GB) 100 meters

Selected Answer: A
Cat 5 can only transfer up to 100 megabits per second.

Selected Answer: D
the correct answer is D OR EVEN C but definitely not A

Selected Answer: A
Cat5 can oly transfer up to 100 mbps. To have a full gigabit connection with ethernet, you need Cat5e, or later.

Selected Answer: A
Although in the real world, you can often get gigabit even with cat 5 depending on length and other factors.

Selected Answer: A
limiting the transfer speed its cat 5

questions.question_text: A user reports a cell phone is getting hot. Which of the following are MOST likely to be possible causes? (Choose three.)

choices.D: Less than 15% free storage space on the phone
choices.A: Using the device as a Wi-Fi hotspot
choices.G: Granting too many application camera permissions
choices.F: Recurring prompts to install OS updates

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACH
A. Using the device as a Wi-Fi hotspot - When a cell phone is used as a Wi-Fi hotspot, it is constantly sending and receiving data and communicating with other devices, which can cause it to get hot.

C. A failing battery - A failing battery can become hot and cause the cell phone to overheat. The battery may need to be replaced if it is no longer holding a charge or is swelling.

H. Too many open applications - Having too many open applications can put a strain on the device's processor and cause it to get hot. The user should close any applications that are not being used to help reduce the heat generated by the device.

Selected Answer: ACH
While having less than 15% free storage space on a phone (option D) can affect performance and cause the device to slow down, it is not typically a direct cause of the device overheating. The primary factors that lead to a phone getting hot are usually related to high power consumption and intensive processing tasks, such as:

Using the device as a Wi-Fi hotspot (A): This requires continuous data transmission and reception, which can generate significant heat.
A failing battery ©: A malfunctioning battery can overheat due to inefficiencies and potential internal damage.
Too many open applications (H): Running multiple apps simultaneously can strain the processor and other components, leading to increased heat.

Selected Answer: ACH
Can I ask why it wouldnt be Granting too many apps camera permission?

Would it be because even though it has access its not actually using the camera because the apps arent open.

I think I was thinking too much into it and thinking coz they had access they would use the camera maliciously which would make the phone hot.

But also phones nowadays, even tho you have the apps open actually shadow close themselves if 3 or more apps are open and/or have not been used for a while. So they actually have to reopen themselves when clicked on.

I picked A,C,G but I do think that H would be the better answer as it doesnt state anywhere in the question that G the apps that the camera would be using are malware or open in anyway

Selected Answer: ACH
agreed.

Selected Answer: ACH
Correct
